metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4862 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in libtelnet/encrypt.c in telnetd in FreeBSD 7.3 through 9.0, MIT Kerberos Version 5 Applications (aka krb5-appl) 1.0.2 and earlier, Heimdal 1.5.1 and earlier, GNU inetutils, and possibly other products allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long encryption key, as exploited in the wild in December 2011.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
heimdal-clients-x - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
heimdal-kcm - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
heimdal-kdc - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
heimdal-multidev - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
heimdal-servers - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
heimdal-servers-x - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libasn1-8-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libgssapi3-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libhcrypto4-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libhdb9-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libheimbase1-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libheimntlm0-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libhx509-5-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libkadm5clnt7-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libkadm5srv8-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libkafs0-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libkdc2-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libkrb5-26-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libotp0-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libroken18-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libsl0-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
libwind0-heimdal - 1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2
No subscription required

inetutils-ftp - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-ftpd - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-inetd - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-ping - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-syslogd - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-talk - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-talkd - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-telnet - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-telnetd - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-tools - 2:1.8-6
inetutils-traceroute - 2:1.8-6
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> from DSA: "Kerberos support for telnetd contains a pre-authentication buffer overflow". did not check if this is protected via stack-protector yet mdeslaur> all affected code is in universe binaries

criterions.comment: heimdal package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6git20120311.dfsg.1-2').
inetutils package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.8-6').
